instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: SSD differences between <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs 3437 (despite same physical connect) ?
threads.message:
I just noticed something this evening, A SSD ( SanDisk 655-1837c Sd6pq4m-128g-1021 128gb ) works in my <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, but doesn't show up as a device on my  <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards (either of the two working ones I have).

Is there an electrical/signalling difference of the SSD interface between the 3437 and 00165 such that the 3437 cannot use SSDs out of a 00165 board?  All I get is the blinking folder.

The SSD is fine, if I plug it in to my <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP Retina it boots up no trouble (unfortunately I do not have access to the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> any more, as I traded off my last one).

threads.title: SSD differences between <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs 3437 (despite same physical connect) ?
threads.message:
Already installed High Sierra APFS update? If SSD has High Sierra and the 3437 doesn't have the APFS (boot ROM ending in .B00) update, and the 00165 does, the 3437 won't "see" it.

Check pin out of SSD for 3437 vs. 00165; I feel like someone has asked this before and it did not work.

threads.title: SSD differences between <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs 3437 (despite same physical connect) ?
threads.message:
SSD was used on a clean-install on a 00165 with HS,  so that makes some sense.  Any way up updating the 3437 to have APFS support?  I've got a HS USB installer stick... I should answer my own question and try it.

I did ask a few weeks ago about a SSD from a system that -was- from a 3437 and showed up as a no-valid-partition crossed out circle on boot; that at least was a simple case of reinstall macOS and it was fine to use.

threads.title: SSD differences between <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs 3437 (despite same physical connect) ?
threads.message:
[USER="515"]SMMRepair[/USER] you were right ( and yes, it's showing up, so looks like it just wants the update )

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/34915-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b-ssd-not-detecting[/url]
